node.title: A new COVID-19 variant has been detected in South Africa. This is what we know
node.description: After a new COVID-19 variant emerged in southern Africa, scientists, health officials and the public are concerned, and the World Health Organization is monitoring the situation closely. Here is what we know.
node.content:
["Just as it looked like control of COVID-19 was within reach, news of a new variant in southern Africa has scientists, health officials and the public concerned.\u00a0", "Currently known as B.1.1.529 \u2014 and likely to be named\u00a0by the World Health Organization (WHO) \u2014\u00a0the new variant has been detected in more than 20 samples taken from COVID-positive people in South Africa.\u00a0", "That's not a lot of people, in a country of 60 million.", "However, the variant has turned up just as daily cases shot up in South Africa, so experts are worried it could be the most potent strain yet. Here is what we know.\u00a0", "
Are scientists worried about the new variant?\u00a0
", "Yes. Cautiously.\u00a0", "There is still a lot of research that needs to be done, but scientists are alarmed by the number of changes in this variant's genetic code.\u00a0", "It's normal for viruses to mutate over time, so scientists pay close attention when those changes alter how the virus behaves.", "Professor Edward Holmes, who studies the emergence of infectious diseases, said the fact that this variant\u00a0is so distinct from other variants is a worry.", "\"It is definitely a serious concern,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It has mutations throughout the spike protein that might make it able to evade immune responses.\"", "Tulio de Oliveira, a bioinformatician with South Africa's Centre for Epidemic Response and Innovation, said at a public briefing that the new variant had\u00a0a \"very unusual constellation of mutations\".", "He explained that scientists had picked up more than 30 changes just to the spike protein, 10\u00a0of which could alter the part of the virus that binds to human cells.", "The Beta variant had three mutations to this part, and Delta just two, he said.", "", "
South Africa is trying to increase vaccination rates, particularly in remote communities.(Reuters: Siphiwe Sibeko, File photo)
", "What's worrying about this is that vaccines \u2014\u00a0our best defence against COVID-19 \u2014\u00a0work by teaching our body to recognise and disable these parts of the virus.", "If they change too much, our immune systems might not notice them until it's too late and we are badly infected.", "As Professor Tulio de Oliveira explained, some of the changes have been seen before and scientists know how they affect the virus's behaviour, but others have only been rarely seen.", "\"So the full significance is still uncertain,\" he said.", "
Where has the variant spread so far?\u00a0
", "So far, the new variant has been found in three countries: Botswana, South Africa and Hong Kong.", "It was first discovered in Botswana earlier this month, and the case in Hong Kong was a returned traveller from South Africa.", "In South Africa, most of the confirmed cases have been found in the Gauteng province, which takes in the cities of Johannesburg and Pretoria.", "However, there are indications it has spread more widely.", "As it happens, one of the mutations to the spike protein shows up in one of the regular tests used to diagnose COVID-19.", "Richard Lessells, an infectious disease physician at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that indicated the new strain was already turning up in other provinces across South Africa.", "\"It gives us concern that this variant may already be circulating quite widely in the country,\" he said.", "
What are health authorities doing about it?\u00a0
", "On the ground in South Africa, health authorities have urged people to continue sanitising their hands, wearing masks in public and avoiding events that could spread the virus widely.", "They are also working to increase vaccination rates, but apathy and hesitancy have proved a challenge.", "
Is this\u00a0a COVID-19 variant of concern or a variant of interest?\u00a0
", "As of Friday afternoon, the WHO\u00a0was still working that out.\u00a0", "\"Right now, researchers are getting together to understand where these mutations are and what that potentially may mean for our diagnostics, our therapeutics and our vaccines,\" WHO COVID-19 technical lead Maria Van Kerkhove said on Friday.\u00a0", "\"It will take a few weeks for us to understand what impact this variant has. There's a lot of work that is underway.\"\u00a0", "The WHO's technical working group is meeting today\u00a0(Friday, November 26) to assess the new variant and decide whether it is a variant of concern or a variant of interest. It may also decide to give it a name from the Greek alphabet, like it had for its predecessors, Alpha, Beta and Delta.\u00a0", "
Will Australia ban travel to and from South Africa?
", "The United Kingdom has temporarily banned incoming flights from parts of Africa, however,\u00a0Health Minister Greg Hunt said there were no plans to change Australia's travel rules \u2014\u00a0yet.", "\"If the medical advice is that we need to change [border restrictions], we won't hesitate,\" Mr Hunt\u00a0said.", "\"At this stage, the advice of the Chief Medical Officer \u2026 is that there's no basis for change.\"", "Mr Hunt pointed out that Australia was in a very different position now to when the previous variant of concern, Delta, emerged in India.", "\"At this point in time, there's very little traffic directly between South Africa and Australia. We also happen to be very highly vaccinated,\" he said.", "
What are scientists now looking out for?\u00a0
", "There is still a lot we don't know about this variant, and that's why scientists are watching it closely.\u00a0", "Professor Holmes said research needed to be done into how the B.1.1.529 differs from the Delta variant, and how the spike protein mutations affect its transmissibility.\u00a0", "\"We need to act very quickly and monitor its spread, and do the essential biology to find out \u2026 is this particular variant able to spread very quickly? And does it have immune-evasive properties?\" he said.", "\"That's the crucial thing that needs to be done, like, right now.\"", "But, with so many unknowns, Professor Cunningham said it was important to watch the variant carefully.", "\"We have to be careful not to cry wolf,\" he said.", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
